<<<<<<< HEAD
The history of Polybius the Megalopolitan The fiue first bookes entire: with all the parcels of the subsequent bookes vnto the eighteenth, according to the Greeke originall. Also the manner of the Romane encamping, extracted from the discription of Polybius. Translated into English by Edward Grimeston, sergeant at armes. Historiae. English Polybius. Grimeston, Edward.
[16], 480, [16] p., folded plate
Printed by Nicholas Okes for Simon Waterson, London : 1633.
A translation of: Historiae. The first leaf and the last leaf are blank. The folded plate is a xylographic and typographic plan. Includes index. One of three imprint variants dated 1633 or 1634. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
The history of Polybius the Megalopolitan The fiue first bookes entire: with all the parcels of the subsequent bookes vnto the eighteenth, according to the Greeke originall. Also the manner of the Romane encamping, extracted from the discription of Polybius. Translated into English by Edward Grimeston, sergeant at armes. Historiae. English Polybius. Grimeston, Edward.
[16], 480, [16] p., folded plate
Printed by Nicholas Okes for Simon Waterson, London : 1633.
A translation of: Historiae. The first leaf and the last leaf are blank. The folded plate is a xylographic and typographic plan. Includes index. One of three imprint variants dated 1633 or 1634. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
